section.title: OS-9 Error Codes
section.para: The error codes are shown both in hexadecimal (first column) and decimal (second column). Error codes other than those listed are generated by programming languages or user programs.

row.entry: E$PthFul PATH TABLE FULL - The file cannot be opened because the system path table is currently full.
E$BPNum ILLEGAL PATH NUMBER - Number too large or for non-existant path.
E$BMode ILLEGAL MODE - attempt to perform I/O function of which the device or file is incapable.
E$DevOvf DEVICE TABLE FULL - Can't add another device
E$BMID ILLEGAL MODULE HEADER - module not loaded because its sync code, header parity, or CRC is incorrect.
E$DirFul MODULE DIRECTORY FULL - Can't add another module
E$MemFul MEMORY FULL - Level One: not enough contiquous RAM free. Level Two: process address space full
E$UnkSvc ILLEGAL SERVICE REQUEST - System call had an illegal code number
E$ModBsy MODULE BUSY - non-sharable module is in use by another process.
E$BPAddr BOUNDARY ERROR - Memory allocation or deallocation request not on a page boundary.
E$EOF END OF FILE - End of file encountered on read.
NOT YOUR MEMORY - attempted to deallocate memory not previously assigned.
E$NES NON-EXISTING SEGMENT - device has damaged file structure.
E$FNA FILE NOT ACCESSIBLE - file attributes do not permit access requested.
E$BPNam BAD PATH NAME - syntax error in pathlist (illegal character, etc.).
E$PNNF PATH NAME NOT FOUND - can't find pathlist specified.
E$SLF SEGMENT LIST FULL - file is too fragmented to be expanded further.
E$CEF FILE ALREADY EXISTS - file name already appears in current directory.
E$IBA ILLEGAL BLOCK ADDRESS - device's file structure has been damaged.
ILLEGAL BLOCK SIZE - device's file structure has been damaged.
E$MNF MODULE NOT FOUND - request for link to module not found in directory.
SECTOR OUT OF RANGE - device file structure damaged or incorrectly formatted.
E$DelSP SUICIDE ATTEMPT - request to return memory where your stack is located.
E$IPrcID ILLEGAL PROCESS NUMBER - no such process exists.
E$NoChld NO CHILDREN - can't wait because process has no children.
E$ISWI ILLEGAL SWI CODE - must be 1 to 3.
E$PrcAbt KEYBOARD ABORT - process aborted by signal code 2.
E$PrcFul PROCESS TABLE FULL - can't fork now.
E$IForkP ILLEGAL PARAMETER AREA - high and low bounds passed in fork call are incorrect.
E$KwnMod KNOWN MODULE - for internal use only.
E$BMCRC INCORRECT MODULE CRC - module has bad CRC value.
E$USigP SIGNAL ERROR - receiving process has previous unprocessed signal pending.
E$NEMod NON-EXISTENT MODULE - unable to locate module.
E$BNam BAD NAME - illegal name syntax.
E$BMHP BAD HEADER - module header parity incorrect
E$NoRam RAM FULL - no free system RAM available at this time
E$BPrcId BAD PROCESS ID - incorrect process ID number
E$NoTask NO TASK NUMBER AVAILABLE - all task numbers in use

section.title: Device Driver/Hardware Errors
section.para: The following error codes are generated by I/O device drivers, and are somewhat hardware dependent. Consult manufacturer's hardware manual for more details.

row.entry: E$Unit UNIT ERROR - device unit does not exist
E$Sect SECTOR ERROR - sector number is out of range.
E$WP WRITE PROTECT - device is write protected.
E$CRC CRC ERROR - CRC error on read or write verify
E$Read READ ERROR - Data transfer error during disk read operation, or SCF (terminal) input buffer overrun.
E$Write WRITE ERROR - hardware error during disk write operation.
E$NotRdy NOT READY - device has "not ready" status.
E$Seek SEEK ERROR - physical seek to non-existant sector.
E$Full MEDIA FULL - insufficient free space on media.
E$BType WRONG TYPE - attempt to read incompatible media (i.e. attempt to read double-side disk on single-side drive)
E$DevBsy DEVICE BUSY - non-sharable device is in use
E$DIDC DISK ID CHANGE - disk removed and replaced
E$Lock RECORD IS BUSY - record is locked out by another user.
E$Share NON-SHARABLE FILE BUSY - entire file is locked out by another user.
E$DEADLK I/O DEADLOCK ERROR - two processes are attempting to use the same two disk areas simultaneously.
